meanings.definition: Of or relating to a calyx.
meanings.sent1: The calycine petals protected the delicate flower bud.
meanings.sent2: The botanist studied the calycine structures of various plants.
meanings.sent3: The calycine cover of the flower looked like a tiny green umbrella.
meanings.sent4: Her calycine hands gently cradled the fragile bloom.
meanings.sent5: The calycine shape of the plant's base was like a protective shield.

meanings.sent1: The calycine flower bloomed beautifully in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The calycine plant displayed vibrant colors in the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The calycine petals danced in the breeze, showing off their colors.
meanings.sent4: Her calycine necklace was made of tiny flower buds strung together.
meanings.sent5: The calycine structure of the plant provided support and protection.

meanings.sent1: The calycine shape of the vase mimicked a flower's protective covering.
meanings.sent2: The calycine design on the fabric added a touch of nature to the dress.
meanings.sent3: The calycine pattern on the wallpaper made the room feel like a garden.
meanings.sent4: Her calycine hair accessory looked like a blooming flower tucked behind her ear.
meanings.sent5: The calycine appearance of the sculpture captured the essence of nature.
